page.title: 10Tourism in Wetton
page.content: Tourism in Wetton is a large trade. There are more tourists in summer than in winter. Some tourists do damage to Wetton. For example, they knock down walls and write on public toilet walls. They also trample down mowing grass and sometimes smash glass bottles in the fields which can damage the cows and sheep. It can especially damage the sheep if they are in lamb, because it can make the sheep's lamb stillborn, which means the lamb is born dead. They throw litter and they sometimes trespass on private property. The people at large don't seem to realise that a lot of tourists come to Wetton all year round. If tourists bring their dogs on holiday, they sometimes chase after the sheep. It could damage the sheep badly. Shop owners do a good trade in summer but not a lot in winter.
